name: Sheraton Suites Galleria Atlanta

reviews.text: My work is bringing me to the Galleria area monthly and I am trying out local hotels. Unfortunately, this one didn't meet my expectations for a quiet nights sleep. I'll start with the pros: I liked the size of the 700sq ft corner room. Overall size of the property is nice with a lot of amenities, and public spaces were clean. Cons: After reviewing other traveler reviews, I requested a "quiet room in the back" based on a few of the "tips" found on Trip Advisor. When I checked in, I was informed that they "have taken care of me" and "we got you". If at all possible, do what I wish I had done: Gone back downstairs and asked for a room not facing the highway. The headboard rattled due to the volume of traffic that is right across the road. I made due and it was fine, but will not return. I do have to mention that the bathroom was not cleaned well, but no need to harp. You get the idea.
reviews.title: Not a great business hotel

reviews.text: They hotel is just a block from 285, very easy on and off the freeway. The parking is convenient also, but it is not free! and I got charged double but then did did reverse it.
reviews.title: Nice Property Convenient Location

reviews.text: The lobby was small but the suite I had was VERY nice and quite large. I was at the hotel for less than 6 hours total but this would have been a hotel I could have stayed at for days and been happy with it.
reviews.title: Bad Experience,Poor Service

reviews.text: Other than having to pay for parking there is not a singe thing I can complain about this hotel. It would be a great place for families.
reviews.title: Great room.

reviews.text: Went online to book a $79 special that included parking and internet. Internet tried to charge me $134 when I clicked on the $79 Book icon. I called reservations only to get a lady who kept saying that I had to book on the internet. Next I called the front desk only to get no help. They switched me 3 times and finally connected me with the front desk supervisor. She explained that the $79 was only when they had a lot of rooms available and currently they did not, never mind what their website said. Finally she booked me in for $119 and said I was all set. When I arrive, they have no reservation for me. The front desk supervisor, Ian, was no help. He wanted to charged me even more than the $119. I finally got him to go to THEIR website where he found the $79 rate and tried to book me. He could not book me on THEIR website either. He then goes in the back for about 5 minutes and returns and gives me the $79 rate with free parking and internet. When I got my bill the next day they had charged an internet fee. I finally got that corrected and got out of that place.
reviews.title: Great service, but a bit tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for somewhere to eat supper before the Jeanne Robertson show and the Cobb Energy Center Saturday night. We anticipated large crowds at all of the trendy chain restaurants around the Galleria and usually like to avoid that if possible. Being a fan of restaurant.com, I searched for restaurants in the vicinity of the Energy Center. We decided to give the Grill at the Sheraton Suite Galleria a try and were not disappointed. Being a hotel restaurant, it was fairly small - about 10 or 12 tables. The waiter was cleaning one other table when we came in, but we were the only people there the entire time we were there. The bar had a couple of tables and there seemed to be a couple of people dining in that area. The menu is very limited, but our food was excellent. My husband ordered the "Chef's inspiration" which was a salmon dish and I chose a simple hamburger and fries. Our waiter seemed a "unprepared" but otherwise was attentive and very polite. I would not make a special trip just to eat there, but would certainly eat there again if looking for a meal in the area. I have no hesitation in recommending The Grill.
reviews.title: We Only Visited the Restaurant (The Grill) But It Was Very Good

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night while doing an across-states move. It is a bit outside the city proper but in a nice area with a lot of shopping/restaurants around. Really appreciated the low pet fee as we had a dog with us and most other Atlanta hotels were charging a minimum of $100 pet fee while this one only charged $25-35. The room was very spacious, very comfy, had 2 large flat screen TVs. Granite countertops. You can tell this hotel is old, which is why the rooms feel as though they need a renovation, but it really is just fine, and most of all - CLEAN. I really liked this hotel & would stay there again if ever in the area.
reviews.title: Cozy, comfortable. So what if it needs a little updating??

reviews.text: Great lobby, but the "great" about this hotel ends there. The rooms are dingy, poorly ventilated, and deeply in need of rennovation/upgrading. Anyone with allergies/asthma won't be able to stay here (a distressing trend with the "Sheraton" brand ). The staff was great though - when I asked them to help me find another nearby SPG hotel that was newer/recently renovated, Jule & Ian at the front desk were outstanding.
reviews.title: Badly Needs Updating

reviews.text: There's not much controversial one way or another to say about the Sheraton Suites in Atlanta - it was convenient for my work trip, the rooms were clean and comfortable, it was nicely located next to the mall for food and shopping (all can be accessed by foot, a nice bonus). The staff was friendly and professional (and definitely gave me a warm welcome as SPG Gold), the wifi worked well, the morning buffet was more than adequate. Basically, it's got all the standards you'd expect from a Sheraton done at the level you'd expect.
reviews.title: Nice, comfortable, friendly staff, just a tad dated

reviews.text: The only drawback is the physical facilities are just a tad dated. The bathrooms could use upgrades, the HVAC system was a bit old, and some of the common spaces just look a bit mid-1990s.
reviews.title: Some definite problems that need attention

reviews.text: I will definitely return because it's a nice, clean hotel, I get my Starwood points and it's conveniently located for my work purposes, but with some physical upgrades it could be more than adequate which is what it is now.
reviews.title: Nice Property
Nice "Starwood Preferred Guest" Points location
reviews.text: This is a great stop for using Starwood Preferred Guest points in Atlanta. The pool is heated and "Spa Like". We stayed here on our visit to the Georgia Aquarium. Also close and convenient to Moody Air Force Reserve Base. Plenty on restaurants close by for a variety of meal options and cost points.

Stayed at this Sheraton for a halfway business trip and halfway pleasure trip meeting up with some friends in Atlanta July 19th to 21st in room 1419. It was a great location right off the highway, close proximity to a mall where i was able to eat most of my meals, and gas station in walking distance to get some snacks and drinks my first night. I thought our room was a great value. Very spacious, clean and comfortable. The little things were overlooked like the curtain rod was on the floor, just very small things. Overall a great stay and I was sooo excited to write a good review and rave about how great the experience was until check out came. They somehow managed to charge me three times for the room!!!! the reservation was made through booking.com but they said that this was a hotel made error that I was charged this many times. I sent booking.com bank statements and the hotel receipt and they contacted the hotel. Through speaking with their front desk agent Nyla, they said that one refund should come through, which it did, and that another one may or may not process through within 14 days. I'm left here just waiting and wondering for 14 days if a refund will ever come which makes me mad and uncomfortable. No call from the hotel to apologize or any contact other than through booking.com. Disappointing to see such a great place run so poorly.
reviews.title: Nightmare after check out!!!!

reviews.text: We moved out of a downtown area hotel to this hotel to be with family, and we were disappointed. The lobby area is nice and updated. However, the rest of the hotel is in need of renovations. The hallways are dark and the room had a bad smell. I went to sit down on the couch and sunk right in. The tub had stains in it and the water temperature was not adjustable; it was too hot for a child and even myself. The parking garage is dark and a little scary. They offer better prices when you prepay, but it is non-refundable. If it was refundable, I would have checked out immediately. I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Did not meet expectations
reviews.text: My husband and I are currently staying at the Sheraton for a little work and some recreation. While the rooms are clean and the hotel is well located, the lack of internet availability in the rooms is a big issue for us. Wireless connectivity is available in the lobby, but there is a $10 per day charge if you want to connect to wireless in guest rooms. We would have sprung for this daily charge, but the hotel couldn't get the wireless to work in the room, either. They sent someone to take care of this issue for us. He came to our room and told us he would reset the router and would return to our room the make sure everything was working. He never returned and the internet connection was not repaired. The second big issue is that the sliding doors between the sitting area and the bedroom are stuck in the open position. This might not be a big issue for most people, but is a huge one for us since we have different sleep and work schedules and it makes it difficult to move around the room without disturbing each other. The door to the bathroom and a closet door are also stuck and will not slide. I will complain when I check out, but do not want to spend what is left of vacation waiting on repairs or moving to another hotel. Obviously, I wouldn't recommend this hotel and will not stay here on my next trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been staying at this property one week out of every year. Upon checking out on our last visit May 2013, we drove my brand new 2013 SUV up to the front doors of the hotel to load our luggage. We leaned the bellman cart against a pillar since the landing area had an incline and the bellman cart was very wobbly and without brakes. Suddenly, the bellman cart started to roll and then slammed into my new SUV...it bounced and hit it again. We reported this to the manager on duty, "Jason" and he came out and took pictures and I filled out an accident report. To make a long story short. The hotel and insurance company blew me off stating they were not responsible. I am very upset about this. I am still sending this information to the State Insurance Commissioner and to the CEO of Starwood Properties for their review. Never again will I stay at this hotel after the way they blew me off! Once very disappointed Guest!
reviews.title: BELLMAN CART HAD NO BRAKES FOR A HOTEL BUILT ON A HILL!
